oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Ray Charles' Friendship album panel discussion - 2006-10-29
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Discussion on the Ray Charles album Friendship from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on October 29, 2006. In support of the exhibit I Can’t Stop Loving You: Ray Charles and Country Music.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Rick Blackburn; Margie Hunt; Ricky Skaggs; Buddy Emmons; Ron Reynolds;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Includes questions from the audience. Moderated by Michael Gray. (00:03) Opening comments / (04:00) Introduction of panel participants / (14:40??) Rick Blackburn talks about bringing Ray Charles to the CBS records roster / (19:40) The mind set of Nashville at the time of his signing and the thinking that Charles was taking up a slot from younger artists / (21:54) Ray being nominated for the CMA Horizon award / (22:50) Appearing on Ralph Emery's radio show / (24:24) Margie Hunt talks about Ray's input into the album / (25:30) Story about Hank Williams Jr. and a controversy over the song What'd I Say / (27:10) Margie talks about what the Nashville music community meant to Ray Charles / (29:44) Plays the recording of the song Friendship / (32.21) Ricky Skaggs talks about working with Ray / (33:10) The selection of the song Friendship written by Cole Porter / (36:20) Ricky talks about blending roots music and Ray Charles music /

(38:20) Ricky comments on Ray talking about his love of bluegrass music / (42:08) Plays the recording of the song Wichita Lineman featuring the pedal steel playing of Buddy Emmons / (45:25) Buddy Emmons talks about his first recording sessions with and meeting Ray / (49:50) Rick tells story about Ray wanting Buddy Emmons on the Friendship sessions / 50:22 Buddy tells story about Ray asking him to put the musicians together and Ray's musical temperament / (53:52) Ricky talks about overdubbing vocal parts with Ray in the control room coaching / (56:43) Ron Reynolds talks about engineering the Friendship album, Ray's contributions to the sound of the album and gives his opinion on why Ray liked the sound of the steel guitar / (01:00:10) Rick answers question about Ray's RPM studios in California and relates story about Quincy Jones stopping by while Rick is meeting with Ray there / Meeting with Ray at his home /
